item.title: FIXED! Saving Character Appearance [FIXED!]
item.dc:creator: @ghostly150 ghostly150
item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

First it has to save the 19 ints when a character file is created, then when they log out it saves the appearance the character chose, and when they log back in it should load those ints… As of now, it is not doing any of that :\

here: (these are the files ive edited to try and make this work)
PlayerHandler.java
Players.java
ClientHandler.java

item.title: FIXED! Saving Character Appearance [FIXED!]
item.dc:creator: @Mario_PvP Mario PvP
item.description:
@Mario_PvP wrote:

i have this in my public int loadgame

[code] public int loadgame(String playerName, String playerPass) {
for (Integer bUid : server.bannedUid) {
if (uid == bUid.intValue()) {
return 4;
}
}

	long start = System.currentTimeMillis();
	String line = "";
	String token = "";
	String token2 = "";
	String[] token3 = new String[3];
	boolean EndOfFile = false;
	int ReadMode = 0;
	BufferedReader characterfile = null;
	boolean charFileFound = false;
	int[] playerLooks = new int[19];[/code]

maybe you should add

int[] playerLooks = new int[5];

in yours.

item.title: FIXED! Saving Character Appearance [FIXED!]
item.dc:creator: @ghostly150 ghostly150
item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

Update: Hi guys… I finally fixed it!

Hi,

I’ve been monkeying around with this HybridScape source I got (the original one, i think). I’ve changed it so that it doesn’t use the “donttouch.txt” as a template for creating a new character file. I’m having trouble with saving the character’s appearance. I’ve been trying to fix this problem all afternoon, searching, researching, actually trying different codes. I can’t figure it out.

In short, I need to make the character’s appearance (look) save somehow when they log out, and load it when they log back in.

I’ve set up the saving/loading system similar to delta’s mixed with some of the existing code in Hybridscape source. Let me know if you need any codes that I have, and I shall post them if needed.

Here: This is what I have so far…

ClientHandler.java in public void loadGame:

case 4: if (token.equals("character-look")) { playerLook[Integer.parseInt(token3[0])] = Integer.parseInt(token3[1]); } break;

ClientHandler.java in public void makeNewUser:

/*LOOK*/ characterfile.write("[LOOK]", 0, 6); characterfile.newLine(); int[] Looks = getLook(); for (int i = 0; i < playerLook.length; i++) { characterfile.write("character-look = ", 0, 17); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(i), 0, Integer.toString(i).length()); characterfile.write(" ", 0, 1); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(Look[i]), 0, Integer.toString(Look[i]).length()); characterfile.newLine(); } characterfile.newLine();

PlayerHandler.java in saveGame:

/*LOOK*/ characterfile.write("[LOOK]", 0, 6); characterfile.newLine(); int[] Looks = plr.getLook(); for (int i = 0; i < plr.playerLook.length; i++) { characterfile.write("character-look = ", 0, 17); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(i), 0, Integer.toString(i).length()); characterfile.write(" ", 0, 1); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(Look[i]), 0, Integer.toString(Look[i]).length()); characterfile.newLine(); } characterfile.newLine();

Let me know if I need to supply any further information!

Thanks,
Ghostly150

Read full topic
